intro: Anaxagorea minor, commonly known as the small anaxagorea, is a tropical evergreen tree belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions such as Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely on the stems. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, black seeds.
